name: USA Mixed Sports! Multiple Choice Quiz | USA Mixed Challenge | 10 Questions

questions.text: I was drafted as a wide receiver in the 1994 NFL draft. I wore the number 88 jersey. Quarterbacks such as Kurt Warner and Marc Bulger have thrown passes to me during my illustrious 15-season career.  Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Isaac Bruce.

	Isaac Bruce was drafted by the Rams franchise in 1994. He helped lead the team to Super Bowl in 1999. In 2008, he played for the San Francisco 49ers. Marvin Harrison also wore the number 88 jersey as did Keyshawn Johnson, and both were taken in the first round of the 1996 NFL draft.  Jack Snow wore the number 84 for the Rams.  Isaac had over 900 catches, over 14,000 yards, and more than 80 touchdowns in his career.

questions.text: Allen Iverson of the NBA accomplished something as a rookie that had never happened before.  What was it?
questions.correct: Scored 40+ points in five consecutive games
options: Was ejected from 10 games in the season
Averaged 32.5 points per game in the season
questions.explanation:
Scored 40+ points in five consecutive games.

	Iverson was a rookie in the 1996-97 season with the Philadelphia 76ers.  He averaged 7.5 assists and 23.5 points per game.

questions.text: Which player hit the perfect 9 dart finish in the 2008 Grand Slam of Darts?
questions.explanation:
James Wade.

	James hit his first televised 9 dart finish via 180, 180, then hitting T20, T19, and double 12.

questions.text: In 2008, which of these teams were members of the Atlantic Coast Conference (ACC)?
questions.explanation:
Miami, Duke, Wake Forest.

	Georgia Tech, NC State, Clemson, and Maryland were also in the ACC in 2008.

questions.text: The windshield on a Nascar race car is made of which material?
options: It is the same as passenger cars
questions.explanation:
Lexan.

	It is actually made out of a bulletproof material called Lexan, which most cashier windows and aircraft cockpit windows are made of.  This was put in race cars to protect the driver if an object hits the windshield at speed, and also to help keep it intact during a crash.

questions.text: Who coached the NCAA Michigan Wolverines football team in 2008?
questions.explanation:
Rich Rodriguez.

	He was the former coach at WVU before he came to Michigan.  2008 was Rich's first season with the Wolverines, but their 3-9 record was not much of a welcome.

questions.text: I was a quarterback drafted in 1991 by the Atlanta Falcons. In 1992, I caught my first pass for a loss of one yard. I have played for at least three different teams.  Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Brett Favre.

	In 1991 with the Falcons, Brett Favre threw 4 passes.  Two were intercepted and the other two were incomplete. In 1992 with the Green Bay Packers, he completed his first-ever pass, to himself. He has not caught a pass since. Favre was a New York Jet in 2008.  In his career, he passed for over 61,000 yards and threw over 400 touchdowns.

questions.text: USA swimmer Mark Spitz won an amazing seven Gold Medals in one Olympic Games.  Which year in Munich did this occur?
questions.explanation:
1972.

	Mark demonstrated a tremendous accomplishment, although it was over-shadowed by the Munich Massacre, which experienced a historical Palestinian terrorism attack during the Games.

questions.text: Which of the following NCAA football teams is not nicknamed "Tigers"?
questions.explanation:
California.

	California's nickname is the Golden Bears.

questions.text: Who won the BDO World Championship of Darts in 2008?
questions.explanation:
Mark Webster.

	Mark beat Australian Simon Whitlock in the 2008 final.
